did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The materials by and relating to Leary in this collection were assembled by rare books and contemporary art dealer John McWhinnie.

This collection contains circa 150 items comprised of manuscripts and documents by Leary; letters to and from Leary, including additional correspondence concerning him; documents and manuscripts relating to Leary's colleagues and associates in the psychedelic movement, and the various institutions and organizations they created; and psychedelic-related ephemera.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Timothy Leary (1920-1996) was an American psychologist and writer known for advocating the exploration of the therapeutic potential of psychedelic drugs.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The materials by and relating to Leary in this collection were assembled by rare books and contemporary art dealer John McWhinnie.

This collection contains circa 150 items comprised of manuscripts and documents by Leary; letters to and from Leary, including additional correspondence concerning him; documents and manuscripts relating to Leary's colleagues and associates in the psychedelic movement, and the various institutions and organizations they created; and psychedelic-related ephemera.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Timothy Leary Manuscripts and Ephemera, #8593. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Series I: Leary manuscripts and documents
Typescript photocopy, Declaration of Independence for Dr. Timothy Leary. July 4, 1971 (Draft)

scopecontent.p: Statement defending Leary, with autograph note: "Allen Ginsberg arranged! / [sketch of smiling heart] / "Timothy Leary / 9-19-95." Draft text for pamphlet of the same title.

did.unittitle: Declaration of Independence for Dr. Timothy Leary. July 4, 1971

scopecontent.p: Reprint from Journal of Personality. Vol. 20, no. 2. December, 1951. Pages 143-161

did.unittitle: Psychedelic Prayers after the tao te ching

scopecontent.p: New Hyde Park, N.Y.: University Books. n.d.

did.unittitle: Summary of the Dissertation Submitted in Partial Satisfaction of the Requirements for the Degree of Doctor of Philosophy

scopecontent.p: University of California, Graduate Division, Northern Section.

did.unittitle: The Neo-American Church Catechism and Handbook: A Review by Timothy Leary
A Constructive Proposal to End the LSD Crisis
Religious Implications of Consciousness Expanding Substances

scopecontent.p: Reprinted from Religious Education
Description of personal DMT experience
Summary of LSD research at Harvard for a Los Angles audience
An addendum describing Leary's recent activities since the publication "of this book" (presumably Starseed).
Check for five dollars payable to "NAACP," on American Trust Company account, Oakland, CA. Cancellation stamps.
Contains Leary's essay, "Progress Toward Solving the Problem of Race Relations," (pp. 41-43).
A typed description by Leary, heavily annotated, of his first meeting with Huxley, his initial purchase of LSD, and the group they gathered to conduct the first experiment (which included Huxley)
Leary's description of taking LSD in Mexico and engaging in a threesome
Description and purposes of the League for Spiritual Discovery, "a non-profit religious association" which advocated the use of LSD. Leary listed as first member of "Board of Guides" (p.5).

did.unittitle: United States Corps of Cadets Card, issued to Leary
The Religious Experience: Its Production and Interpretation
Typescript of "revision of the article on drugs," for Esquire magazine
Reactions To Psilocybin Administered in a Supportive Environment.

scopecontent.p: Reprint from The Journal of Nervous and Mental Disease, Vol. 137, No. 6, December 1963
Leary justifies his plea of not guilty to federal drug charges.

did.unittitle: Americans and Mushrooms in a Naturalistic Environment: A Preliminary Report

scopecontent.p: Three original typescript pages from a longer interview of Leary, which has been heavily edited and emended in autograph, possibly by him.
Original typescript

did.unittitle: "One night in the winter I crossed the Rockies…"

scopecontent.p: Original typescript story featuring Little Richard, Fatty Arbuckle, Floyd Patterson, and talking goats.
Original typescript of article describing a San Francisco peace rally.

Typescript essay, untitled. ("A journalist in the Haight-Ashbury is hung on a strange dilemma.")

scopecontent.p: Annotated in Leary's hand
Autograph notes in pencil and ink, on verso of circular letter, unsigned, from James Goddard, Commissioner of Food and Drugs

did.unittitle: A group of photocopied legal contracts between Leary and Michel- Gustave Hauchard relating to the publishing and film rights of various Leary works

scopecontent.p: Many with original ink annotations in Leary's hand

scopecontent.p: Report on his happiness and optimism about his legal situation: "We too are enjoying Heaven…"
With: Photocopy of "United States of America vs. Timothy Leary: Change of Counsel."

scopecontent.p: Leary thanks him for sending various publications and speculates about possible titles for his forthcoming book.

did.unittitle: Autograph letter signed, "James Peter Cavagnaro" to "Jan."

scopecontent.p: Writing from prison, he praises Leary's and Hesse's ideas on liberation and spiritual energy.
Together with: Appeal Against Further Trial & Persecution of Dr. Timothy Leary

scopecontent.p: Krassner informing Leary that his new article was to be entitled "Dr. Leary – or How I Learned to Transcend Ego and Expand My Consciousness (Notes from a Found Weekend)."

did.unittitle: Typed note signed, "A.C. Spectorsky" to "Dr. Leary."

scopecontent.p: Stapled to: Typed letter signed, from "Tim Leary" to "Mr.Spectorsky." With: Playboy Interview: Timothy Leary. Also with: Leary, Timothy. Typescript on Ira Cohen, LSD, and Cannabis
Watts states that the both the FDA and Myron Stolaroff of the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) suspected the current liquid LSD in circulation had very serious impurities

did.unittitle: Typed letter signed in type, "Your Flower Peter" to "Dr. Timothy Leary."

scopecontent.p: Orlovsky — Ginsberg's lover — writing Leary about his experiences with LSD.

did.unittitle: Typed letters signed, "Art Kleps" to "Dr. Kissinger" and "Editor, Time Magazine."

scopecontent.p: Kleps writes Kissinger in the midst of the Watergate crisis, and states the good that might come if the conspirators ended up in the same prison as Leary
A draft of Leary's "Signal From Galactic Transmission Center to Planet Earth," which presents as "call home" from extraterrestrial species to the human race.

did.unittitle: Typed letter signed, from "Richard Alpert" to "Dr. Hofmann"

scopecontent.p: A letter written by Alpert on behalf of Leary, who was in Mexico at the time.

did.unittitle: Typed letter signed, to Dr. Humphry Osmond, with partial draft

scopecontent.p: Metzner disputes Osmond's critical positionson both the Psychedelic Review and Leary.
Describing his travel plans
Metzger encloses (not present) several brochures about upcoming psychedelic seminars and workshops.
On verso: Family Dog Presents Poster.

did.unittitle: Neo-American Church Catechism and Handbook Brochure

scopecontent.p: Together with: Card insert: "How to Use Your Head." Mass mailer for presentation by Leary and Alpert on Sunday, November 29, 1964, at Town Hall in New York. Leary has amended the brochure to eliminate both the Castalia Foundation and Richard Alpert's names throughout, and change the title to "Psychedelic Workshops Conducted by Timothy Leary, Ph.D. and Ralph Metzner, Ph.D."
Invitation to a public baseball tournament, as well as other psychedelic news.

did.unittitle: Selected Bibliography on the Safety of LSD-25

scopecontent.p: A small selection of books and articles supporting the safety of LSD, some with additional quotes and reviews.
An announcement for a lecture by Leary and Richard Alpert.
Program for a League event, with Leary acting as "Guide," Ralph Metzner as "Harry, the Imprisoned Intellectual," and others in other roles.
The Psychedelic Review with TLS, from Felix Morrow and Ralph Metzger as well as a Psychedelic Review Subscription Direct Mail Package.

The LSD Issue: A New Look at the World

scopecontent.p: A typescript teleplay for video featuring Dana Farnsworth, Dr. Theodore Rothman, Dr. Roy Grinker, and various experimental subjects, among others. No record of it having been produced has been found. Hitchcock-Balding Productions, to which the teleplay is addressed, also produced several of Leary's live speaking events, and had been engaged by the League of Spiritual Discovery to handle their public business.
